TO PERMIT MR. INGERSOLL TO PROCEED WITH HIS REMARKS IN FAVOR OF HIS MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE HOUSE ADOPTED THE AMENDMENT OF MR. ADAMS, REPEALING THE 21ST RULE RESPECTING RECEPTION OF PETITIONS FOR THE ABOLITION OF SLAVERY, TO THE RESOLUTION OF MR. WISE FOR THE ADOPTION TEMPORARILY OF THE RULES AND ORDERS OF THE LAST HOUSE FOR THE RULES OF THIS.  (P. 40-2)

ADAMS AMENDMENT IS TO REPEAL RULE 21, BY WHICH THE RECEPTION BY CONGRESS OF PETITIONS FOR THE ABOLITION OF SLAVERY IS PROHIBITED.  (P. 42-1)

TO ORDER THE MAIN QUESTION ON THE MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE HOUSE AGREED TO MR. ADAMS' AMENDMENT RESPECTING RULE 21, TO MR. WISE'S RESOLUTION PROVIDING FOR THE TEMPORARY ADOPTION OF THE RULES AND ORDERS OF THE LAST HOUSE AS THE RULES OF THIS HOUSE.

TO SUSTAIN THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT IT WAS IN ORDER FOR THE HOUSE TO PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION RELATING TO THE ELECTION OF A HOUSE PRINTER.

TO ADOPT THE SECOND PART OF THE HOUSE RES. RELATING TO THE HOUSE PRINTER, WHICH PROVIDES THAT THE COMPENSATION TO THE PRINTER SHALL BE 20% LESS THAN THAT FIXED BY JOINT RESOLUTIONS OF 1819.  (P. 43-3)
TO RECONSIDER THE PREVIOUS VOTE  ADOPTING THE RESOLUTION TO ELECT A HOUSE PRINTER AND TO FIX HIS COMPENSATION. (P. 44-1)
TO ELECT A HOUSE PRINTER AND TO LIMIT HIS COMPENSATION. VOTES FOR GALES AND SEATON ARE CODED 1, FOR BLAIR AND RIVERS ARE CODED 2, FOR PETER FORCE ARE CODED 5.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND CONSIDER THE RESOLUTION REPORTED FROM THE RULES COMMITTEE CONFIRMING THE ACTION OF CONGRESS TO MATTERS CITED IN THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE CALLING A SPECIAL SESSION.  (p. 89)
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND INTRODUCE S. 1.  A BILL TO REPEAL AN ACT KNOWN AS THE "INDEPENDENT TREASURY LAW."  (P. 49-1)

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND INTRODUCE THE H.RES. PROVIDING THAT THE ACTION OF THE SEVERAL STANDING COMMITTEES, ONES THEREIN, ON ALL MATTERS NOT EMBRACED IN THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE, BE SUSPENDED UNTIL THE SESSION IN DECEMBER, EXCEPT BANKRUPTCY LAW AND PETITIONS.
TO REFER A PETITION PRAYING FOR A GENERAL BANKRUPTCY LAW TO THE JUDICIARY COMMITTEE, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO INQUIRE INTO THE EXPEDIENCY OF REPORTING SUCH A LAW AT THIS SESSION OF CONGRESS.  (P. 49-2)
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON THE RECEPTION OF A PETITION TO ABOLISH SLAVERY FROM THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AND FLA.  (P. 49-2)
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON THE APPOINTMENT OF OF A SPECIAL COMMITTEE TO CONSIDER ALL PETITIONS FOR THE ABOLITION OF SLAVERY AND THE SUPPRESSION OS SLAVE TRADE BETWEEN STATES.  (P. 49-2)
TO TABLE THE MOTION TO RECEIVE THE PETITION FOR THE ABOLITION OF SLAVERY IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AND FLA. (P. 49-2)
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON THE MEMORIAL FROM PENNSYLVANIA TO REVISE AND INCREASE THE PRESENT TARIFF.
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON THE MEMORIAL FROM MARYLAND TO PLACE TOBACCO USED IN THE MANUFACTURE OF CIGARS ON THE FREE LIST AND INCREASE DUTY ON FOREIGN CIGARS.

TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON THE REPORT OF THE RULES COMMITTEE THAT ALL PETITIONS NOT SPECIFICALLY REFERRED TO IN THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE BE OBJECTED TO AND TABLED. THIS REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON RULES WAS MADE PURSUANT TO THE DUTY ASSIGNED THEM TO REPORT AMENDMENTS TO THE RULES OF THE LAST HOUSE, TEMPORARILY ADOPTED (BY MR. WISE'S RESOLUT- ION) AS THE RULES OF THIS HOUSE.  (MR. WISE'S RESOLUTION HAD ALSO PROVIDED THAT THE COMMITTEE ON RULES REPORT ON ANY AMENDMENTS OR REVISIONS OF THE RULES)
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON THE REPORT OF THE RULES COMMITTEE.
TO TABLE THE REPORT OF THE RULES COMMITTEE.
TO AGREE TO THE REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON RULES.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE HOUSE ADOPTED THE REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON RULES.
TO ORDER A CALL OF THE HOUSE.

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON THE MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE SELECT COMMITTEE ON RULES WAS APPOINTED AND AUTHORIZED TO REPORT ON REVISIONS OF THE RULES AND BY WHICH THE RULES OF THE LAST HOUSE, EXCEPT THE 21ST., HAD BEEN TEMPORARILY ADOPTED.  (THIS WAS THE WISE RESOLUTION.)

TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE HOUSE AGREED TO THE WISE RESOLUTION, PROVIDING FOR THE TEMPORARY ADOPTION OF THE RULES AND ORDERS OF THE LAST HOUSE AS THE RULES OF THIS, FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF A SELECT COMMITTEE ON RULES TO REPORT ON NECESSARY REVISIONS OF THE RULES, AND AS AMENDED BY MR. ADAMS, PROVIDING FOR THE REPEAL OF THE 21ST RULE, FORBIDDING THE RECEPTION ON ANTI-SLAVERY PETITIONS.
TO ADJOURN, DURING DEBATE ON THE RULES OF THE HOUSE.

TO SUSTAIN THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT THE HOUSE HAVING RECONSIDERED THE VOTE ADOPTING THE RESOLUTION APPOINTING A COMMITTEE TO REPORT RULES FOR THE GOVERNMENT OF THE HOUSE, THE PROCEEDING WAS RESTORED TO THE PRECISE POINT AT WHICH IT WAS WHEN THE QUESTION TO AGREE WAS PUT.
TO ALLOW MR. FLOYD TO PROCEED IN HIS REMARKS, ALTHOUGH THEY WERE IRRELEVANT TO THE QUESTION BEFORE THE HOUSE.  (P. 55-1)

TO DIVIDE AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE ORGINAL WISE RESOLUTION ON ADOPTING TEMPORARILY THE RULES OF THE LAST HOUSE, ETC, BECAUSE THE HOUSE WAS ACTING UNDER THE "LEX PARLIAMENTARIA.  THE AMEND. PROVIDES (1) THAT THE STANDING RULES BE ADOPTED UNTIL OTHERWISE ORDERED; (2) THAT THE COMMITTEE HERETOFORE APPOINTED BE ORDERED TO REVISE ONE REPORT.

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE PROVIDING THAT THE STANDING RULES OF THE HOUSE BE ADOPTED UNTIL OTHERWISE ORDERED; AND THAT THE COMMITTEE HERETOFORE APPOINTED ON THE RULES BE ORDERED TO REVISE, AMEND AND REPORT UPON THE SAID RULES AND ORDERS, AND THAT THE OFFICERS HERETOFORE CHOSEN BY THE HOUSE AND COMMITTEE RAISED BY ITS ORDER BE AND THEY ARE HEREBY CONFIRMED.
TO ADOPT THE SUBSTITUTE RESOLUTION THAT RULES OF THE LAST CONGRESS BE ADOPTED UNTIL OTHERWISE ORDERED AND TO APPOINT A COMMITTEE OF NINE MEMBERS TO REVISE AND REPORT TO THE HOUSE. (P. 55-3)

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON THE ORIGINAL RESOLUTION OF MR. WISE, AS AMENDED BY MR. ADAMS.  THE ORIGINAL RESOLUTION PROVIDED FOR THE ADOPTION OF THE RULES OF THE LAST HOUSE, FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF A SELECT COMMITTEE AND RULES, AND AS AMENDED FOR THE REPEAL OF THE 21ST RULE.  THIS RESOLUTION IS BEING VOTED ON AS THE RESULT OF SUCCESSFUL MOTION TO RECONSIDER ITS ADOPTION (VAR. 67), AND OF THE FAILURE OF INTERVENING MOTIONS TO AMEND BY SUBSTITUTING (VARS. 71, 72 AND 73)
TO ADOPT THE ORIGINAL RESOLUTION OFFERED BY MR. WISE REGARDING THE RULES TO GOVERN THE HOUSE, AFTER A SUCCESSFUL MOTION TO RECONSIDER.  (P. 55-3)
TO SUSPEND FURTHER ACTION UNDER A CALL OF THE HOUSE. (P. 63-2)

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON THE RESOLUTION OFFERED BY MR. STUART PROVIDING THAT THE RULES OF THE LAST CONGRESS, NOT SUPERSEDED BY ANY NOW IN FORCE, BE ADOPTED FOR THE PRESENT HOUSE AND THAT THE SELECT COMMITTEE ON RULES PROCEED TO REVISE THE RULES HERETOFORE ADOPTED.  (P. 57-1)

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION OFFERED BY MR. STUART PROVIDING THAT THE RULES OF THE LAST CONGRESS, NOT SUPERSEDED BY ANY NOW IN FORCE, BE ADOPTED FOR THE PRESENT HOUSE AND THAT THE SELECT COMMITTEE ON RULES PROCEED TO REVISE THE RULES HERETOFORE ADOPTED.
TO ADOPT A RESOLUTION RELATING TO HOUSE RULES, AND PROVIDING THAT THE DAILY HOUR OF MEETING OF THIS HOUSE SHALL BE 10 A.M.  (P. 65-2)
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND CONSIDER A RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT AFTER NEXT SATURDAY, AND FOR THE ENSUING WEEK, THE SPEAKER WILL ADJOURN THE HOUSE EACH DAY AT NO LATER THAN 3 P.M.  (P. 65-3)
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND CONSIDER THE RESOLUTION REQUESTING FROM THE PRESIDENT AND THE CABINET THE NAMES OF ALL OFFICERS REMOVED FROM OFFICE AND THE REASON FOR THEIR REMOVAL. (P. 65-3)

TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON A RESOLUTION PROPOSING THE APPOINTMENT OF A COMMITTEE OF 5 TO INQUIRE IN- TO THE CONTINGENT EXPENSES OF THE HOUSE AND INTO ANY COR- RUPT, ILLEGAL OR IMPROPER PRACTICES WHICH MAY HAVE EXISTED IN THIS BRANCH OF THE PUBLIC SERVICE.

TO SUSTAIN THE DECISION OF THE CHAIR THAT THE REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON RULES MAY BE ACCEPTED BY A MAJORITY VOTE WITH- OUT ONE DAY'S NOTICE OR A 2/3 VOTE.  THE REPORT RECOMMENDED AMENDING RULE #127, SO THAT IT WILL NOT BE IN ORDER TO MOVE A SUSPENSION OF THE RULES FOR ANY PARTICULAR PURPOSE UNTIL AFTER THE DAILY CALL FOR PETITIONS, REPORTS OF COMMITTEES, AND RESOLUTIONS HAS BEEN COMPLETED, EXCEPT FOR A MOTION TO PROCEED TO THE ORDER OF THE DAY.  (P. 73)

TO ADOPT THE REPORT OF THE SELECT COMMITTEE AMENDING RULE 127, PROVIDING THAT IT SHALL NOT BE IN ORDER TO MOVE SUSPENSION OF RULES UNTIL AFTER DAILY CALL FOR PETITIONS, REPORTS OF COMMITTEES, AND RESOLUTIONS.  (P. 72-3)
TO CONCUR IN A REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE THAT $25,000 BE PAID TO THE WIDOW OF THE LATE PRESIDENT WM. H. HARRISON.  (P. 67-3)
TO PASS THE RESOLUTION AWARDING A PAYMENT OF $25,000 TO THE WIDOW OF PRESIDENT WM. H. HARRISON.  (P. 49-3)
TO TABLE THE PETITION FROM CITIZENS IN THE STATE OF PENNSYLVANIA ASKING CONGRESS TO TAKE INTO CONSIDERATION BOTH A REVISION AND AN INCREASE OF THE TARIFF.  (P. 77-1)
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT THE SELECT COMMITTEE ON THE CURRENCY BE DIRECTED TO INQUIRE INTO THE EXPENDIENCY OF ESTABLISHING A NATIONAL BANK ON A SPECIFIED PLAN. (P. 84-3)
TO PRINT THE HOUSE RES. DIRECTING THE SELECT COMMITTEE ON CURRENCY TO INQUIRE INTO THE EXPEDIENCY OF ESTABLISHING A NATIONAL BANK.  (P. 171)
TO ADOPT THE H.RES. THAT 10,000 EXTRA COPIES OF THE REPORT OF THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY ON THE FINANCES BE PRINTED. (P. 87-3)
TO ORDER THE MAIN QUESTION ON THE RECONSIDERATION OF THE VOTE REFERRING THE SENATE BILL REPEALING THE SUB-TREASURY BILL, TO THE COMMITTEE ON WAYS AND MEANS.  (P. 89-1-2-3)
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE HOUSE AGREED TO REFER THE SENATE BILL TO REPEAL THE SUB-TREASURY BILL, TO THE WAYS AND MEANS COMMITTEE.  (P. 92)
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION REQUESTING THE PRESIDENT FOR INFORMATION REGARDING WHETHER ANY OFFICER IN THE ARMY OF THE ATT. GEN. HAD VISITED N.Y. IN CONNECTION WITH THE MC LEAD CASE.  (P. 124-2)
TO RESOLVE INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE.  (P. 134-1)
TO ADJOURN, DURING DEBATE ON H.R. 4, A BILL APPROPRIATING THE PROCEEDS OF THE SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS, AND TO GRANT PRE- EMPTIVE RIGHTS.  (JP. 203)
TO RESOLVE INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE.  (P. 152-3)

TO SUSTAIN THE DECISION OF THE CHAIR THAT THE SELECT COMMITTEE ON RULES COULD REPORT IN PART, AT DIFFERENT TIMES AND BY PIECEMEAL, WITHOUT GIVING ONE DAY'S NOTICE ON GETTING A 2/3 VOTE AS REQUIRED BY RULE 127.  THE RULING WAS MADE AFTER THE SELECT COMM., PURSUANT TO THE RESOLUTION EMPOW- ERING THEM TO REPORT ON NECESSARY REVISION OF THE RULES (VAR. 78) HAD REPORTED THE FOLLOWING AS AN AMENDMENT TO THE 127TH RULE. "AND ALSO OF PROVIDING FOR THE DISCHARGE OF THE COMMITTEE FROM THE CONSIDERATION OF ANY BILL REFERRED TO THEM AFTER ACTING, WITHOUT DEBATE, UPON ALL AMENDMENTS PENDING AND THAT MAY BE OFFERED."

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON THE AMENDMENT OFFERED BY MR. BRIGGS TO THE REPORT OF THE SELECT COMMITTEE ON RULES. THE AMENDMENT PROVIDES TO ADD TO THE AMENDMENT TO RULE 127 PROPOSED BY THE COMMITTEE ON RULES THE WORDS, "AFTER IT MAY OR SHALL BE IN COMMITTEE AT LEAST SIX DAYS."
TO AMEND THE REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON RULES BY ADDING TO THE PROPOSED AMENDMENT TO RULE #127 THE WORDS, "AFTER IT MAY OR SHALL HAVE BEEN IN THE COMMITTEE AT LEAST 6 DAYS."
TO TABLE THE REPORT FROM THE SELECT COMMITTEE ON RULES AS AMENDED.

TO TABLE THE MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE HOUSE ADOPTED THE BRIGGS AMENDMENT TO THE COMMITTEE REPORT WHICH AMENDMENT DEALT WITH THE LENGTH OF TIME A BILL MUST REMAIN IN COMMITTEE BEFORE BEING DISCHARGED.  (P. 154-3)
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE HOUSE ADOPTED THE BRIGGS AMENDMENT REGARDING THE DISCHARGING OF A BILL FROM COMMITTEE, TO THE COMMITTEE REPORT OF THE HOUSE RULES. (P. 154-3)

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO THE REPORT OF THE SELECT COMMITTEE ON RULES.  THE ORGINIAL AMENDMENT PROVIDED THAT A BILL MUST HAVE BEEN IN THE COMMITTEE FOR 6 DAYS BEFORE IT CAN BE DISCHARGED.  AFTER THE MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE AGREEING TO THIS AMENDMENT WAS SUCCESSFUL, MR. BRIGGS MOVED TO AMEND HIS ORGINAL AMENDMENT BY CHANGING "SIX DAYS" TO "FOUR DAYS."
TO AGREE TO THE REPORT OF THE RULES COMMITTEE.

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON PASSAGE OF A RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT DEBATE IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE ON H.R. 4, A BILL TO APPROPRIATE THE PROCEEDS OF THE SALES OF THE PUBLIC LANDS AND TO GRANT PRE-EMPTION RIGHTS, SHALL CEASE FROM AND AFTER 7 O'CLOCK TODAY.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT DEBATE ON H.R. 4 SHALL CEASE AT 7 P.M. TODAY.  (P. 155)
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON H.R. 4.
TO TABLE H.R. 4.

TO TABLE AN APPEAL FROM A DECISION OF THE CHAIR.  THE CHAIR HAD RULED THAT A MOTION TO AMEND A MOTION TO REFER H.R. 8, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR VARIOUS FORTIFICATIONS FOR ORDNANCE AND FOR PREVENTING AND SUPPRESSING INDIAN HOSTILI- TIES, TO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE.  WAS NOT IN ORDER. THE MOTION TO AMEND THE MOTION TO REFER WOULD HAVE ADDED INSTRUCTIONS TO THE COMMITTEE TO REPORT A PROVISION THAT THE SALES OF THE PUBLIC LANDS SHALL BE USED IN COMPLETION OF THE WORKS SPECIFIED IN THIS BILL.
TO ADOPT THE H.RES. AMENDING RULE 28 SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT NO MEMBER BE ALLOWED TO SPEAK MORE THAN ONE HOUR ON ANY QUESTION.  (P. 155-2)
TO RESOLVE INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE.  (P. 164-3)

TO ADOPT THE H.RES. PROVIDING THAT AFTER 2 P.M. NEXT THURSDAY ALL DEBATE IN THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE ON BILL H.R. 5, AUTHORIZING A LOAN FOR A SUM NOT EXCEEDING 12 MILLION DOLLARS, SHALL CEASE, AND THE COMMITTEE SHALL PROCEED TO VOTE ON PENDING AMENDMENTS, THEN REPORT THE SAME WITH AMENDMENTS AGREED TO.
TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON AGREEING TO THE AMENDMENT OF THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO H.R. 5.  (p. 191-1)
TO ENGROSS AND ORDER THE THIRD READING OF H.R. 5.
TO PASS H.R. 5.  (P. 191)
TO PASS BILL H.R. 7, (8-3-41), MAKING FURTHER PROVISION FOR THE MAINTENANCE OF PAUPER LUNATICS IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.  (P. 193-2)
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DISCUSSION OF BILL H.R. 6, (8-16-41), PROVIDING FOR THE PAYMENT OF NAVY PENSIONS. (P. 195-2)

TO AGREE TO REPEAL THE ACT OF 3-3-1837, AFTER THE FIRST DAY OF JANUARY NEXT; PROVIDED PENSIONS TO WIDOWS AND TO CHILDREN OF NAVAL OFFICERS AND SEAMEN AND MARINES WHO HAVE DIED IN THE NAVAL SERVICE OF THE U.S., ALREADY ESTABLISHED SHALL CONTINUE FOR A PERIOD OF FIVE YEARS AFTER JUNE 3, 1841, IN THE SAME MANNER AND EXTEND AS IF THE ACT OF 1837 HAD NOT BEEN REPEALED.

TO TABLE A RESOLUTION AND AMENDMENTS THERETO.  THE RESOLUT- ION PROVIDES THAT THE SEVERAL CABINET OFFICERS REPORT TO THE HOUSE:  THE NUMBER OF PERSONS EMPLOYED IN THEIR DEPTS, HOW MUCH THEY ARE COMPENSATED, AND WHAT "REFORM AND RETRENCHMENT MAY BE REASONABLE AND PRACTICABLE IN DIMINISH- ING NO. OF PERSONS EMPLOYED.  "THE RESOLUTION MAKES FURTHER PROVISIONS SPECIFICALLY RELATING TO THE DEPARTMENT OF THE TREASURY.

TO AGREE TO THE FIRST DIVISION OF AN AMENDMENT TO AN AMENDMENT OFFERED BY MR. CAVE JOHNSON TO A RESOLUTION REQUESTING INFORMATION ON THE NUMBER OF PERSONS IN PUBLIC SERVICE.  MR. JOHNSON'S AMENDMENT REQUESTED INFORMATION FROM THE PRESIDENT AS TO THE NAMES OF PERSONS WHO DERIVE THEIR APPOINTMENT FROM THE PRESIDENT AND THE ADVICE AND CONSENT OF THE SENATE WHO HAVE BEEN REMOVED FROM OFFICE SINCE THE FOURTH OF MARCH LAST, AND THE REASONS FOR THEIR REMOVAL. THE FIRST DIVISION OF THE AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT "THEY ALSO REPORT THE NAMES OF ALL OFFICERS REMOVED UNDER SIMILAR CIRCUMSTANCES SINCE THE FOURTH OF MARCH, 1829."

TO AGREE TO THE SECOND DIVISION OF AN AMENDMENT TO AN AMENDMENT OFFERED BY MR. JOHNSON TO A RESOLUTION REQUESTING IMFORMATION FROM THE SEVERAL CABINET OFFICERS AS TO THE NUMBER OF PERSONS EMPLOYED IN THE PUBLIC SERVICE.  THE SECOND DIVISION REQUESTS INFORMATION AS TO WHY THE ADMINISTRATION HAS NOT REMOVED FAITHLESS AND INCOMPETENT OFFICERS WITH MORE DISPATCH.

TO AGREE TO THE JOHNSON AMENDMENT AS AMENDED TO A RESOLUTION REQUESTING INFORMATION FROM THE SEVERAL CABINET OFFICERS AS TO THE NUMBER OF PERSONS EMPLOYED IN THE PUBLIC SERVICE AS AMENDED, THE JOHNSON AMENDMENT REQUESTS A LIST OF ALL PUBLIC OFFICERS DISCHARGED OR REMOVED SINCE MARCH 3, 1829.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION RELATING TO THE NUMBER OF EMPLOYEES IN THE PUBLIC SERVICE, AS AMENDED TO REQUEST INFORMATION AS TO THOSE REMOVED FROM OFFICE SINCE MARCH 3, 1829.

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON THE INSTRUCTIONS RELATIVE TO H.R. 8, (9-9-41), MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR VARIOUS FORTIFICATIONS FOR ORDNANCE AND FOR PREVENTING AND SUPRESS- ING INDIAN HOSTILITIES, WHICH INSTRUCTIONS ASK FOR A LIMIT- ING OF DEBATE.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION LIMITING DEBATE ON BILL H.R. 8.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE HOUSE ADOPTED THE RESOLUTION OF INSTRUCTION LIMITING DEBATE ON H.RES. 8.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING DEBATE ON BILL H.R. 8 SHALL CEASE AT 12 P.M. JULY 20, 1841.
TO TABLE THE MOTION TO AMEND THE JOURNAL.
TO ELIMINATE FROM H.R. 8 THE APPROPRIATION OF $50,000 FOR FORT DELAWARE.
TO POSTPONE ACTION ON H.R. 8 UNTIL AUG. 2.
TO TABLE H.R. 8.
TO PASS H.R. 8.
TO TABLE THE H.RES. THAT IT IS EXPEDIENT FOR THE HOUSE TO TO TAKE UP THE BANKRUPTCY BILL, REPORTED FROM THE COMM. ON THE JUDICIARY, FOR CONSIDERATION AT THE PRESENT SESSION OF CONGRESS.
TO PASS H.R. 10, APPROPRIATING $789,310 FOR THE MAINTENANCE OF THE HOME SQUADRON.

TO RESOLVE INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE AND PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION OF THE H.RES. PROVIDING FOR THE APPOINT- MENT OF A COMMITTEE TO TAKE EVIDENCE DURING THE RECESS OF CONGRESS, AT THE PRINCIPAL PORTS OF ENTRY AND ELSEWHERE, AS TO THE OPERATION OF THE EXISTING SYSTEM OF DUTIES ON IMPORTS.
TO TABLE THE H.RES. RELATING TO THE STUDY OF THE EXISTING SYSTEM OF DUTIES ON IMPORTS.
TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON THE H. RES. (9-11-41), RELATING TO A STUDY OF THE EXISTING SYSTEM OF DUTIES ON IMPORTS.
TO ADOPT THE H. RES. RELATING TO A STUDY OF THE EXISTING SYSTEM OF DUTIES ON IMPORTS.
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON RECONSIDERATION OF THE H. RES. RELATING TO A STUDY OF THE EXISTING SYSTEM OF DUTIES ON IMPORTS.
TO ORDER A CALL OF THE HOUSE, MOTION MADE DURING A DISCUSSION RELATING TO THE RECONSIDERATION OF THE H. RES. RELATING TO A STUDY OF THE EXISTING SYSTEM OF DUTIES ON IMPORTS.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE RESOLUTION RELATING TO A STUDY OF THE EXISTING SYSTEM OF DUTIES ON IMPORTS, WAS ADOPTED.

TO POSTPONE, UNTIL THE 2ND MONDAY IN DECEMBER, CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION TO ELECT A SERGEANT-AT-ARMS AND DOOR- KEEPER TO THE SENATE.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION THAT THE SENATE WILL, ON MONDAY MARCH 8, 1841, AT 1 P.M., PROCEED TO ELECT A SERGEANT-AT- ARMS AND DOOR-KEEPER.

TO INSTRUCT THE SECRETARY OF STATE, TO RETURN THE OFFICIAL BOND TO BLAIR AND RIVES, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE RESOLUTION AS ADOPTED TO DISMISS BLAIR AND RIVES AS PRINTERS OF THE SENATE FOR THE 27TH CONGRESS.
TO REMOVE THE INJUNCTION OF SECRECY FROM THE PROCEEDINGS OF THE SENATE AND DEBATE ON THE NOMINATION OF FRANCIS GRANGER TO BE POSTMASTER GENERAL.
TO PRINT LETTERS OF THE ADJUTANT GENERAL AND OF THE SECRE- TARY OF STATE, IN CONNECTION WITH THE MEMORIAL OF GENERAL JESUP.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION TO WAIT ON THE PRESIDENT AND INFORM HIM THAT A QUORUM OF BOTH HOUSES IS ASSEMBLED AND READY TO RECEIVE ANY COMMUNICATIONS HE MAY BE PLEASED TO MAKE, BY SUBSTITUTING THE WORD VICE-PRESIDENT IN PLACE OF PRESIDENT, DUE TO THE DEATH OF THE LATE PRESIDENT.
TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION TO REPEAL AN ACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE COLLECTION, SAFE KEEPING, TRANSFER AND DISBURSEMENT OF THE PUBLIC REVENUE, BY PROVIDING THAT A SUBSTITUTE BILL BE REPORTED.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO THE BILL S. 1 (APP. 8/13/1841) (0), TO REPEAL THE ACT ENTITLED, "AN ACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE COLLECTION, SAFEKEEPING, TRANSFER AND DISBURSEMENTS OF THE PUBLIC REVENUE" AND TO PROVIDE FOR THE PUNISHMENT OF EMBEZ- ZLERS OF THE PUBLIC MONIES, WHICH AMENDMENT REPEALS THAT PART OF SECTION 5 OF THE ACT OF JUNE 23, 1836, WHICH PRO- VIDES THAT NO BANK SHALL ISSUE OR PAY OUT ANY NOTE OR BILL IN AN AMOUNT LESS THAN $5.
TO AGREE TO THE AMENDED AMENDMENT TO S. 1, WHICH REPEALS THE ACT OF JUNE 23, 1836, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE 13TH AND 14TH SECTIONS, AND A SUPPLEMENTARY ACT APPROVED JULY 4, 1836.
TO AMEND S. 1, SO AS TO EXCEPT FROM REPEAL THOSE SECTIONS RELATING TO THE PAYMENT IN SPECIE OF TAXES, DUTIES, DEBTS AND OTHER OBLIGATIONS DUE TO THE UNITED STATES.
TO AMEND S. 1, SO AS TO EXCEPT FROM REPEAL SECTION 21, WHICH PROVIDES THAT ALL DISBURSEMENTS AND DRAFTS DRAWN ON THE GOVERNMENT SHALL BE IN GOLD OR SILVER.
TO AMEND S. 1, SO AS TO EXCEPT FROM REPEAL SECTION 25 WHICH PROVIDES THAT THE TREASURER OF THE UNITED STATES MAY RECEIVE PAYMENT IN ADVANCE FOR PUBLIC LANDS.

TO AMEND S. 1, SO AS TO EXCEPT FROM REPEAL SECTION 25 WHICH PROVIDES THAT THE MINT OF THE UNITED STATES LOCATED AT PHILADELPHIA AND THE BRANCH MINT AT NEW ORLEANS SHALL BE MADE DEPOSITORIES FOR THE PUBLIC MONIES.
TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO S. 1, WHICH PROPOSES TO EXCEPT FROM REPEAL SECTION 2 WHICH WOULD MAKE THE MINT AT PHILADELPHIA AND THE MINT AT NEW ORLEANS DEPOSITORIES FOR PUBLIC MONEY.
TO AMEND S. 1, TO PROVIDE THAT THE BANK OF THE UNITED STATES AND ITS BRANCHES DISCONTINUE THE COLLECTION AND SAFE KEEPING OF THE PUBLIC MONIES.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 1.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL TOMORROW CONSIDERATION OF THAT PORTION OF THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE DEALING WITH FOREIGN RELATIONS.
TO RECOMMIT S. 1  TO THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE WITH INSTRUC- TIONS TO REPORT A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE BILL.

TO RECOMMIT S. 1  TO THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE WITH INSTRUC- TIONS TO AMEND THE BILL TO PROVIDE THAT GUARDS BE FURNISHED TO GUARD THE PUBLIC MONIES RECEIVED FROM THE TIME OF PASSAGE OF THIS ACT UNTIL THEY ARE INFORMED OF SAME, AND TO GIVE THE TREASURY DEPARTMENT AMPLE TIME TO SECURE OTHER BONDS FROM DEPOSITORIES AND RECEIVERS OF PUBLIC REVENUE AS A RESULT OF THE REPEAL OF THIS ACT.
TO ADJOURN; MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF S. 1.
TO ADJOURN; MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON S. 1.
TO PASS S. 1.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION RELATIVE TO THE REMOVAL OF GENERAL MATHEW ARBUCKLE FROM HIS COMMAND AT FORT GIBSON.

TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION THAT WHEN THE SENATE ADJOURNS DURING THE PRESENT SESSION, LEAVING A SUBJECT UNDER DISCUSSION AND UNDECIDED, THE CONSIDERATION OF THE SUBJECT SHALL BE RESUMED AT THE NEXT MEETING OF THE SENATE, IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE JOURNAL IS READ AND PETITIONS AND REPORTS ARE RECEIVED, WITHOUT WAITING FOR THE USUAL HOUR OF 1 P.M..

TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION REQUESTING INFORMATION OF THE SECRE- TARY OF WAR RELATIVE TO FRAUDS COMMITTED BY CONTRACTORS IN THE SOUTHWEST, ALLEGED IN HIS COMMUNICATION TO THE PRESIDENT ON MAY 1, 1841, REGARDING ENORMOUS PROFITS MADE UNDER INDIAN ANNUITIES, AND TO FURNISH THE SENATE WITH THE NAMES OF ALL THESE CONTRACTORS.
TO TABLE A MEMORIAL TO SANCTION AN ACT OF THE LEGISLATURE OF MARYLAND FOR THE COMPLETION OF THE CHESAPEAKE AND OHIO CANAL TO CUMBERLAND.
TO TABLE THE MOTION TO PRINT THE PROCEEDINGS OF THE CITIZENS OF CINCINNATI REMONSTRATING AGAINST THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A NATIONAL BANK.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY IN DECEMBER NEXT, CONSI- DERATION OF THE BILL S. 4 (APP. 8/25/1841) (0), REVIEWING AND EXTENDING THE CHARTERS OF THE DISTRICT BANKS.
TO AMEND S. 4, BY PROHIBITING DISTRICT BANKS FROM ISSUING OR PAYING OUT ANY BILL OR NOTE FOR LESS THAN $20.
TO AMEND S. 4, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT THE STOCKHOLDERS AND OFFICERS OF THESE BANKS BE INDIVIDUALLY LIABLE FOR PENALTIES AS A RESULT OF VIOLATIONS OF THE ACT.
TO AMEND S. 4, SO AS TO GRANT DISTRICT BANKS THE PRIVILEGE OF ISSUING ONE AND TWO DOLLAR NOTES FOR A PERIOD OF TWO YEARS.
TO RECOMMIT S. 4 TO COMMITTEE.
TO POSTPONE, UNTIL TOMORROW, CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL S. 5, TO INCORPORATE THE SUBSCRIBERS TO THE FISCAL BANK OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO RECOMMIT TO THE SELECT COMMITTEE THE BILL H. R. 1 (APP. 6/30/1841), TO GRANT THE SUM OF $25,000 TO MRS. HARRISON, WIDOW OF GENERAL WILLIAM HENRY HARRISON, WHO DIED IN OFFICE AS PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO MAKE A REPORT STATING GROUNDS AND REASONS FOR THE BILL.
TO PASS THE BILL H. R. 1 (APP. 6/30/1841) (0), TO GRANT THE SUME OF $25,000 TO MRS. HARRISON, WIDOW OF GENERAL WILLIAM HENRY HARRISON, WHO DIED IN OFFICE AS PRESIDENT OF THE U. S.
TO AMEND SECTION 18 OF S. 5, WHICH SECTION FORBIDS THE ISSUANCE OF ANY NOTE OF LESS THAN FIVE DOLLARS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT STOCK MAY BE TRANSFER- ABLE ON PAYMENT OF THE SECOND INSTALLMENT INSTEAD OF THE THIRD.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PERMIT BANKS TO INCREASE THEIR DEBT LIMIT FROM 25 TO 30 MILLION DOLLARS.

TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO DIRECT THAT THE PAYMENT OF THE FOURTH INSTALLMENT OF THE FIFTH PARY TO CAPITAL SUBSCRIBED BY THE GOVERNMENT FOR THE ESTABLISHMENT OF BRANCHES, BE MADE BY THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY RATHER THAN BY CONGRESS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENTS AND CASH- IERS OF BRANCHES TO SIGN NOTES, NOT EXCEEDING $20, WHICH ARE MADE PAYABLE AT THEIR SEVERAL OFFICES.
TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 5, SO AS TO GIVE RESIDENT ALIENS THE PRIVILEGE OF PURCHASING STOCK IN THE FISCAL BANK OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO OBLIGE ALL CORPORATIONS OR COMPANIES TO BELONG TO THE SEVERAL STATES OR TERRITORIES AND TO EXCLUDE FROM THE PURCHASE OF STOCK ALL PERSONS OTHER THAN UNITED STATES CITIZENS AND RISIDENT ALIENS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT ANY STOCKHOLDER MAY EXAMINE AND INSPECT ALL PRIVATE AND INDIVIDUAL ACCOUNTS, DEALINGS AND ACCOMMODATIONS AT ANY OF THE OFFICES OF DIS- COUNT AND DEPOSIT.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF ELISHA M. HUNTINGTON TO BE COMMISSIONER OF THE GENERAL LAND OFFICE OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO CHANGE THE DAILY MEETING HOUR OF THE SENATE FROM 10 TO 11 A.M., BEGINNING JULY 6, 1841.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 5, SO AS TO ESTABLISH AGENCIES TO EMPLOY SUCH BANKS TO ACT AS FISCAL AGENTS OF THE GOVERN- MENT, AND TO CONVERT SUCH AGENCIES INTO OFFICES OF DISCOUNT AND DEPOSIT, PROVIDING THAT THEY ARE NOT CONTRARY TO STATE LAWS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO CHANGE SLIGHTLY THE CONDITIONS OF ESTABLISHMENT OF COMPETENT OFFICES OF DISCOUNT AND DEPOSIT IN A STATE.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA SHALL NOT BE DESIGNATED AS A LOCALITY FOR THE FISCAL BANK.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO DESIGNATE NEW ORLEANS AS THE LOCAL- ITY OF THE FISCAL BANK.

TO TABLE THE FOLLOWING RESOLUTIONS: THAT ON THE NOMINATION OF JOHN MC CLINTOCK TO BE NAVAL OFFICER AT PORTSMOUTH, RE- PLACING GEORGE DENNET WHO WAS REMOVED, SUCH REMOVAL DEPEN- DENT ON THE CONSENT OF THE SENATE, THE SENATE BE GIVEN REA- SONS FOR HIS REMOVAL; AND THAT THE PRESIDENT BE REQUESTED, UNLESS CONSTITUTIONAL OBJECTIONS EXIST, TO GIVE TO THE SENATE EVIDENCE THAT REMOVAL OF DENNET WAS NOT ON ACCOUNT OF DIFFERENCE IN POLITICAL OPINION.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT THE CASHIERS OF EVERY OFFICE OF DISCOUNT OR DEPOSIT SHALL, EACH YEAR, SEND TO EACH HOUSE OF CONGRESS, A COMPLETE RECORD OF ALL TRANSACTIONS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT ANY TEN OR MORE STOCK- HOLDERS MAY HAVE THE RIGHT TO EXAMINE THE ACCOUNTS OF PRI- VATE INDIVIDUALS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO REQUIRE BANKS TO KEEP THEIR BOOKS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC SHOWING ALL TRANSACTIONS CONCERNING BILLS AND NOTES.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT NO TRANSACTION IS TO BE KEPT SECRET FROM GOVERNMENT DIRECTORS, AND THEY SHALL BE FREE TO PARTICIPATE IN ALL TRANSACTIONS OF THE INSTITUTIONS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT NO BANK IS TO PAY OUT BULLION.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT ANY CONTRACT FOR RENEW- WAL OR EXTENSION ON ANY LOAN BEYOND 180 DAYS, SHALL BE NULL AND VOID.

TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT ORDERS BE PUBLISHED IN SOME NEWSPAPER, AT THE SEAT OF GOVERNMENT, FROM BANK DIREC- TORS TO MEMBER BANKS.  SUCH ORDERS ARE ALSO TO BE REPORTED BACK TO CONGRESS AND THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY.
TO AMEND S. 5, BY RESTRICTING TO $10,000 THE AMOUNT THAT MAY BE LOANED TO ANY BANK OFFICER OR DIRECTOR.
TO AMEND S. 5, BY PROHIBITING THE BANK FROM MAKING ANY LOANS TO MEMBERS OF CONGRESS.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 5, THE ORIGINAL AMENDMENT OF MR. WOODBURY PROHIBITING DIRECTORS OR STOCKHOLDERS FROM MAKING ANY DONATIONS, AND THE AMENDMENT IN THE SECOND DEGREE PROHI- BITING DONATIONS BEING MADE TO OFFICERS AND STOCKHOLDERS OF THE BANK.
TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 5 WHICH AMENDMENT PERMITS STOCK- HOLDERS TO MAKE DONATIONS OUT OF THE FUNDS OF THE BANK; THE AMENDMENT THERETO PROHIBITS DONATIONS BEING MADE TO OFFICERS OF THE BANK.
TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT ANY DONATION MADE BY THE BANK OR ITS BRANCHES IS NOT TO BE CHARGED AGAINST THE FUNDS OF THE GOVERNMENT.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO ELIMINATE THE PROVISION THAT AFTER 1851 THE BANK MAY INCREASE ITS CAPITAL FROM 30 TO 50 MILLION DOLLARS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO ELIMINATE THE CLAUSE WHEREBY THE GOVERNMENT SUBSCRIBES FOR ONE HUNDRED THOUSAND SHARES OF STOCK OF THE BANK.

TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY SHALL SUBSCRIBE TO ALL STOCK THAT REMAINS UNSUB- SCRIBED FOR BY DECEMBER 20, 1841, AND SHALL BE EMPOWERED TO SELL SAME LATER AT A SUM NOT LESS THAN COST.

TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO ELIMINATE THAT PORTION WHICH ALLOWS THE BANK TO START OPERATING AFTER SIX MILLION DOLLARS HAD BEEN SUBSCRIBED, AND TO INSERT THE PROVISION THAT THE BANK SHALL NOT OPERATE UNTIL THE TOTAL AMOUNT, AS REQUIRED BY LAW HAS BEEN PAID.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT THE PRESIDENT SHALL APPOINT ADDITIONAL DIRECTORS SO THAT INDIVIDUALS HOLDING

TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO MAKE IT THE DUTY OF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL TO RESTRAIN THE FURTHER OPERATION BY ANY FISCAL BANK OF THE UNITED STATES UNABLE TO MAKE SPECIE PAYMENTS, AND TO HAVE A TRUSTEE NAMED IN RECEIVERSHIP; TO ALSO PROVIDE THAT THE BANK'S ASSETS TO PAID TO CREDITORS, THE BALANCE TO GO INTO THE UNITED STATES TREASURY.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 5, PROVIDING THAT "IF THE SAID BANK OR ANY OF ITS BRANCHES SHALL AT ANYTIME SUSPEND SPECIE PAYMENTS, OR NEGLECT OR REFUSE TO DISCHARGE ON DEMAND ANY AND ALL OF ITS LIABILITIES IN SPECIE, THEN ITS BILLS OR NOTES SHALL NO LONGER BE RECEIVED IN PAYMENT OF ANY DEBT OR DEMAND DUE THE U. S.", BY PROVIDING INSTEAD THAT NO NOTES SHOULD BE RECEIVED DURING THE TIME OF SUSPENSION.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT WHICH PROVIDES THAT IF THE SAID BANK OR ANY OF ITS BRANCHES SHALL SUSPEND SPECIE PAYMENTS, OR NEGLECT OR REFUSE TO DISCHARGE ON DEMAND ANY AND ALL OF ITS LIABILITIES  IN SPECIES, THEN ITS BILLS OR NOTES SHALL NO LONGER BE RECEIVED IN PAYMENT OF ANY DEBT OR DEMAND DUE THE U. S., BY PROVIDING THAT SUSPENSION OF SPECIE PAYMENTS SHOULD BE CONSIDERED A CAUSE OF FORFEITURE OF THE CHARTER.
TO ADOPT AND AMENDED AMENDMENT TO S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT SUS- PENSION OF SPECIE PAYMENTS SHALL BE CAUSE FOR FORFIETURE OF THE BANK'S CHARTER.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO DOUBLE THE PERCENTAGE OF RESPONSI- BILITY OF THE BANK DURING A STATE OF SUSPENSION.
TO AMEND S. 5, BY ELIMINATING THAT PORTION WHICH PROVIDES THAT NO OTHER BANK SHALL BE ESTABLISHED DURING CONTINUANCE OF THE PRESENT BANK.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT THE REFUSAL ON THE BANK'S PART TO ALLOW A COMMITTEE FOR CONGRESS TO INSPECT THE BOOKS, SHALL BE CAUSE FOR FORFEITURE OF THE BANK'S CHARTER.
TO AMEND S. 5, BY REDUCING THE RATE OF INTEREST ON LOANS ISSUED BY THE BANK, FROM 6% TO 5%.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF JOSEPH EACHES TO BE COLLEC- TOR OF CUSTOMS FOR THE DISTRICT OF ALEXANDRIA, IN THE DIS- TRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO TABLE THE NOMINATION OF JOSEPH RITTNER, TO BE TREASURER OF THE MINT OF THE UNTIED STATES AT PHILADELPHIA.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF JOHN CHAMBERS TO BE GOVERNOR OF THE TERRITORY OF IOWA.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO THE BILL H. R. 5 (APP. 7/21/1841) (0), TO AUTHORIZE A LOAN OF 12 MILLION DOLLARS FOR THE RE- QUIREMENTS OF THE GOVERNMENT, BY ELIMINATING THE CLAUSE IN THE AMENDMENT WHICH PROHIBITS THE REDEMPTION OF TREASURY NOTES NOT DUE.

TO AMEND H. R. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT THE LOAN SHALL BE NO GREATER THAN THE PRESIDENT SHALL DEEM NECESSARY; AND ALSO TO REDEEM TREASURY NOTES AS THEY BECOME DUE OUT OF MONIES COL- LECTED FROM CUSTOMS, LANDS AND OTHER SOURCES.
TO AMEND H. R. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT THE LOAN SHOULD BE APPLIED TO DEBTS ALREADY CONTRACTED, AND FOR THE DEFENSE OF THE COUNTRY ONLY.
TO AMEND H. R. 5, TO REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF THE LOAN FROM 12 TO 6 MILLION DOLLARS.
TO AMEND H. R. 5, TO REDUCE THE LOAN FROM 12 MILLION TO 9 MILLION DOLLARS.
TO AMEND H. R. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT TWO MILLION DOLLARS OF THE LOAN BE SET ASIDE AS A RESERVE FUND TO MEET CONTINGENCIES WHEN CONGRESS IS NOT IN SESSION.

TO AMEND H. R. 5, TO ELIMINATE SECTION 1 OF THE BILL WHICH PROVIDES THAT THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY MAY DISBURSE SUCH MONIES AS IN HIS OPINION THE GOVERNMENT MAY REQUIRE, AND INSERT THAT MONIES MAY ONLY BE DISBURSED AS ARE APPRO- PRIATED BY CONGRESS.
TO AMEND H. R. 5, TO MAKE IT UNLAWFUL FOR THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO RE-ISSUE ANY TREASURY NOTES THAT MAY HERE- AFTER BE REDEEMED.
TO ADJOURN, DUE TO THE LATENESS OF THE HOUR; MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF H. R. 5.
TO AMEND H. R. 5, SO AS TO LIMIT THE POWER OF THE SECRETARY TO REISSUE TREASURY NOTES.
TO PASS H. R. 5.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT NOTHING IN THIS ACT SHALL IMPAIR THE RIGHT OF ANY STATE TO TAX THE BANK OR ITS BRANCHES.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT THE BUSINESS OF THE BANK SHOULD BE CONFINED TO THE BUYING AND SELLING OF BILLS OF EXCHANGE, WITH A PERIOD NOT EXCEEDING 180 DAYS.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO MAKE STOCKHOLDERS LIABLE FOR THE OBLIG- ATIONS OF THE INSTITUTION.
TO AMEND S. 5 BY PROHIBITING CORPORATIONS FROM HOLDING STOCK IN THIS BANK.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT NO LOAN IS TO BE MADE BY THIS BANK OR ANY OF ITS BRANCHES TO ANY CORPORATION.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO TAKE AWAY THE POWER OF THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO SELL STOCK SUBSCRIBED FOR BY THE UNITED STATES, AND TO GIVE THAT POWER TO CONGRESS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE FOR A SEMI-ANNUAL DIVIDEND AFTER CERTAIN EXPENSES ARE DEDUCTED.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO LIMIT THE POWER OF THE BANKS TO DIS- COUNT ANY NOTES IN CIRCULATION.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO ESTABLISH THE CONDITIONS FOR DISTRI- BUTION AMONG THE BRANCHES OF THE CAPITAL STOCK OF THE BANK.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROHIBIT PRIVATE USE BY ANY OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE BANK, OF THE MONIES WITHIN THE BANK.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO ELIMINATE THE CLAUSE FIXING THE VALUE OF GOLD COINS TO BE RECEIVED BY THE BANK.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO BAN THE DEALING IN COIN.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO SPECIFY WHEN THE BANK IS PERMITTED TO COM- MENCE OPERATING.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF ANDERSON MILLER TO BE UNITED STATES MARSHALL FOR THE SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF MISSISSIPPI.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL S. 6, TO CHANGE THE VENUE IN THE CASES OF THE UNITED STATES VS. CHARLES GRATIOT, FROM MISSOURI TO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL S. 3 (5 STAT. 440, APP. 8/19/1841), PROVIDING A UNIFORM LAW ON THE SUBJECT OF BANKRUPTCY IN THE UNITED STATES.

TO AMEND MR. NICHOLSON'S AMENDMENT TO S. 3, SO AS TO ELIMIN- ATE THE SECTION WHICH WOULD INCLUDE CORPORATIONS "EXCEPT THOSE IN WHICH THE STOCK IS OWNED WHOLLY, OR IN PART, BY A STATE, OR FOR WHICH A STATE IS RESPONSIBLE."
TO AMEND S. 3, SO AS TO INCLUDE BANKING CORPORATIONS IN THE ACT, EXCEPT THOSE WHOSE STOCK IS OWNED, IN WHOLE OR IN PART, BY THE STATE, OR FOR WHICH THE STATE IS RESPONSIBLE.

TO AMEND S. 3, TO ELIMINATE THE PROVISION THAT THIS ACT IS NOT TO ANNUL THE RIGHTS OF MARRIED WOMEN, MINORS, LIENS, MORTGAGES OR OTHER SECURITIES ON PROPERTY, WHICH ARE VALID BY STATE LAWS AND WHICH ARE NOT INCONSISTENT WITH THE SECOND AND FIFTH SECTIONS OF THIS ACT.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 3.
TO PASS S. 3.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT NO PERSON IS TO TRANSFER OR ASSIGN HIS STOCK TO ANY NON-CITIZEN OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 5, OUTLINING THE CONDITIONS UN- DER WHICH STOCKHOLDERS MAY INSPECT INDIVIDUAL OR PRIVATE ACCOUNTS IN SAID BANK OR ANY OF ITS BRANCHES, BY PROVIDING THAT SAID STOCKHOLDERS SHALL HAVE HELD AT LEAST 500 SHARES FOR AT LEAST 3 MONTHS BEFORE THEY MAY INSPECT SAID ACCOUNTS.
TO ADOPT AN AMENDED AMENDMENT TO S. 5, WHICH OUTLINES THE CONDITIONS UNDER WHICH STOCKHOLDERS MAY INSPECT INDIVIDUAL OR PRIVATE ACCOUNTS IN SAID BANK OR ANY OF ITS BRANCHES.
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT TO S. 5, WHICH ELIMINATES THE RESTRICTION ON THE AMOUNT THAT A DIRECTOR OF THE BANK MAY BORROW.
TO ADOPT A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO S. 5, THAT PROVIDES THAT NO NOTE OR BILL SHALL BE DISCOUNTED FOR ANY MEMBER OF EITHER HOUSE OF CONGRESS.
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT TO S. 5, WHICH PROVIDES A LIMIT TO THE SUM THAT ANY OFFICER MAY BE INDEBTED TO THE CORPOR- ATION.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT TEN DOLLARS IS THE LOWEST DENOMINATION NOTE THAT CAN BE ISSUED.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO WITHDRAW THE POWER OF THE PRESIDENT TO APPOINT DIRECTORS TO SAID BANKS, INSTEAD OF ALLOWING CONGRESS TO ELECT THE SAME; WITH PROVISIONS FOR SAID ELECTIONS.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO EXCLUDE CERTAIN PEOPLE FROM BEING ELIGI- BLE TO BECOME A DIRECTOR OR AGENT OF THIS BANK.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO EXCLUDE CERTAIN PEOPLE FROM ELIGIBILITY TO HOLD OFFICE IN THIS BANK; AND TO PROVIDE FOR OFFICERS TO SUBSCRIBE ON OATH THAT THEY ARE NOT VIOLATING THE PROVISIONS OF THIS ACT.
TO AMEND S. 5, BY PROVIDING THAT ALL THE LAWS THAT GOVERN THE PUBLIC MONIES IN THE TREASURY OF THE U.S., SHALL BE APPLICABLE TO MONIES DEPOSITED IN THIS BANK OR ITS BRANCHES.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT NO LOAN SHALL BE MADE TO ANY- ONE IN A LARGER AMOUNT THAN $10,000, SO LONG AS THERE ARE VALID APPLICATIONS AND GOOD SECURITY FOR LOANS OF A LESSER AMOUNT.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT NO CONGRESSMAN, DURING HIS TERM OR FOR TWO YEARS AFTER, SHALL BE EMPLOYED BY THIS BANK OR ITS BRANCHES IN ANY WAY.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT CONGRESS RESERVES THE POWER TO ALTER OR REPEAL THIS ACT, EXCEPT WHERE IT PROVIDES FOR THE PAYMENT OF A LOAN ALREADY CONTRACTED.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROHIBIT LOANS BEING GRANTED TO HEADS OF DEPARTMENTS OF THE GOVERNMENT AND JUDGES OF THE SUPREME COURT.
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON S. 5.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE TO REJECT THE AMENDMENT TO S. 5, WHICH WOULD PERMIT BANKS TO ISSUE $5.00 DENOMINATION NOTES.
UPON RECONSIDERATION, TO AMEND S. 5, TO PERMIT THE BANK TO ISSUE NOTES OF A DENOMINATION OF $5.00.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 5.

TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT BRANCHES MAY BE ESTABLISHED ANYWHERE IN THE UNITED STATES WITH STATE APPROVAL.  AMEND- MENT CONTAINS CONDITIONS FOR SUCH APPROVAL AND CONDITIONS FOR REMOVAL OF SUCH BRANCH.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY CONSIDERATION OF S. 5, IN ORDER TO AWAIT A CONGRESS ELECTED UNDER THE NEW CENSUS.
TO PASS S. 5.

TO AMEND THE BILL H. R. 6 (5 STAT. L 440, APP. 8/16/1841), TO MAKE APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE PAYMENT OF NAVY PENSIONS, BY PROVIDING THAT NO OFFICER SHALL RECEIVE BOTH A PENSION AND PAY FOR ACTIVE SERVICE.
TO AMEND H. R. 6, TO PROVIDE THAT NO OFFICER, SEAMAN OR MARINE ENTITLED TO A PENSION FROM THE NAVY, SHALL RECEIVE BOTH THE PENSION AND PAY FROM THE PUBLIC TREASURY AS AN OFFICER IN SERVICE.

TO AMEND S. 4, TO PERMIT THESE BANKS TO PAY OUT AND CIRCU- LATE THE NOTES OF SUSPENDED BANKS UNTIL MARCH, 1842.  S. 4 (APP. 8/25/1841), IS A BILL TO REVIVE AND EXTEND THE CHAR- TERS OF THE DISTRICT BANKS.
TO AMEND S. 4, TO ALLOW THESE BANKS TO ISSUE THEIR OWN NOTES IN DENOMINATIONS OF ONE AND TWO DOLLARS, DURING CONTINUANCE OF THE SUSPENSION OF SPECIE PAYMENTS BY THE BANKS OF BALTI- MORE AND RICHMOND.
TO AMEND S. 4, TO PROHIBIT SAID BANKS FROM ISSUING BANK NOTES FOR ANY OF THEIR DEBTS.  THE AMENDMENT ALSO STIPULATES THE PENALTIES AND ACTIONS TO BE BROUGHT AGAINST BANKS VIO- LATING THIS ACT.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 4.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL H. R. 7 (APP. 8/3/1841) (0), TO APPROPRIATE FUNDS FOR THE SUPPORT OF PAUPER LUNATICS OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

TO AMEND THE MOTION TO RECOMMIT THE BILL H. R. 8 (APP. 9/9/1841) (0), APPROPRIATING FUNDS FOR THE DEFENSE OF THE COUNTRY AND THE SUPPRESSION OF INDIAN HOSTILITIES, TO COM- MITTEE, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO INCLUDE THE NECESSARY APPROPRI- ATIONS FOR POSTS, FORTIFICATIONS, HARBORS, RIVERS AND MILITARY ROADS ON THE SOUTHWESTERN AND NORTHWESTERN FRON- TIERS WHICH MAY BE DEEMED NECESSARY FOR THE DEFENSE OF THE COUNTRY; SO THAT THE INSTRUCTIONS PROVIDE FOR AN AMENDMENT INCLUDING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FORTIFICATIONS, ETC., TO DEFEND THE WESTERN, NORTHWESTERN, AND SOUTHWESTERN FRONTIERS.

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 8 TO COMMITTEE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO ADD THE NECESSARY APPROPRIATIONS FOR SUCH FORTS FOR THE SOUTH, SOUTHWESTERN, AND NORTHWESTERN FRONTIERS AS MAY BE PROPER FOR THE DEFENSE OF THE COUNTRY.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION TO HOLD EXECUTIVE SESSIONS WITH OPEN DOORS WHEN TREATIES ARE NOT UNDER CONSIDERATION.
TO AMEND H. R. 8, TO APPROPRIATE $50,000 FOR DEFENSIVE WORKS BARACKS, AND THE PURCHASE OF A SITE AT OR NEAR DETROIT, MICHIGAN.
TO AMEND H. R. 8, TO APPROPRIATE $50,000 FOR MILITARY WORKS AT FORT SMITH, ARKANSAS, FOR THE PRESENT AND ENSUING YEAR, IN ADDITION TO AN UNEXPENDED BALANCE.

TO AMEND H. R. 8, TO APPROPRIATE A SUM TO GEORGIA FOR THE SERVICES OF HER MILITIA IN REPRESSING HOSTILITIES IN FLORIDA AND ALABAMA AND PROTECTING THE CITIZENS FROM THE RAVAGES OF THE CREEK AND SEMINOLE TRIBES.
TO AMEND H. R. 8, TO APPROPRIATE A SUM FOR THE ESTABLISHMENT OF AN ARMORY, SOMEWHERE IN THE WEST, TO BE SELECTED BY THE PRESIDENT.

TO AMEND H. R. 8, TO APPROPRIATE A SUM FOR CONSTRUCTION AND ARMAMENT OF STEAMERS AND VESSELS ON THE NORTHWESTERN LAKES, AS MAY BE AUTHORIZED BY TREATY BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND BRITIAN, AS THE PRESIDENT MAY DEEM NECESSARY.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H. R. 8, WHICH PROVIDES $50,000 FOR THE PURCHASE OF A SITE NEAR DETROIT FOR DEFENSIVE WORKS AND BARRACKS, BY ADDING THERETO AN APPROPRIATION OF $75,000 FOR FORTIFICATIONS ON THE OUTLET OF LAKE CHAMPLAIN.
TO AMEND H. R. 8, SO AS TO APPROPRIATE $50,000 FOR DEFENSIVE WORKS AT DETROIT, MICHIGAN.
TO AMEND H. R. 8, BY APPROPRIATING $50,000 FOR DEFENSIVE WORKS AT BUFFALO, NEW YORK.
TO AMEND H. R. 8, SO AS TO APPROPRIATE $150,000 FOR REPAIRS TO FORTS AT NEW ORLEANS, LOUISIANA.
TO AMEND H. R. 8, TO PROVIDE FOR THE CONSTRUCTION AND ARMA- MENT OF STEAMERS ON THE NORTHWESTERN LAKES.

TO TABLE THE MOTION TO PRINT THE RESOLUTION REMONSTRATING AGAINST A NATIONAL BANK DISTRIBUTING THE PROCEEDS OF THE PUBLIC LANDS, AGAINST THE INCREASE OF THE TARIFF AND AGAINST THE CREATION OF A NATIONAL DEBT AND ALSO CONDEMNING THE EXTRA SESSION OF CONGRESS.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 4 (8/26/1841), A BILL TO REVIVE AND EXTEND THE CHARTERS OF THE DISTRICT BANKS.
TO PASS H. R. 8.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 6 (5-STAT. 440, 8-16-1841), A BILL PROVIDING FOR PAYMENT OF NAVY PENSIONS, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES TO DENY THE BENEFITS OF THIS ACT TO PENSIONERS WHO WERE NOT ENTITLED TO THE SAME UNDER THE ACT OF 1837.  THE AMENDMENT THERETO PROPOSES TO GIVE ALL WIDOWS AND CHILDREN OF NAVAL OFFICERS, SEAMEN AND MARINES, NOW DECEASED, A PENSION UNDER THE ACT OF 1837, BUT NOT TO APPLY TO HEIRS OF THESE WIDOWS AND CHILDREN.
TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H. R. 6, TO PROPOSE THAT NO PENSION SHALL BE PAID OUT OF THIS APPROPRIATION TO WIDOWS OR CHILD- REN HAVING RECEIVED A PENSION FOR FIVE YEARS.
TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H. R. 6, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT THE PENSIONS GRANTED UNDER THE ACT OF 1837, SHOULD NOT BE CHARGEABLE UPON THE TREASURY OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO AMEND H. R. 6, SO AS TO REPEAL THE ACT OF 1837 AND TO IN- SERT THAT THE PENSIONS FOR DISABILITY AND TO WIDOWS AND CHILDREN OF THE NAVAL FORCES, SHALL BE IN PROPORTION TO THE PAY RECEIVED BY NAVAL OFFICERS AND MEN AS IT WAS ON JANUARY 1, 1832.

TO SUSTAIN THE RULING OF THE CHAIR, MADE DURING CONSIDER- ATION OF THE MEMORIAL REGARDING PROCEEDINGS AND RESOLUTIONS OF A MEETING HELD AT FAUQUIER COUNTY, VIRGINIA, THE RULING BEING THAT A MOTION TO TABLE AN APPEAL WAS IN ORDER.

TO DECIDE THE POINT OF ORDER RAISED ON APPEAL FROM THE DE- CISION OF THE CHAIR, DURING CONSIDERATION OF THE MEMORIAL REGARDING PROCEEDINGS AND RESOLUTIONS OF A MEETING HELD AT FAUQUIER COUNTY, VIRGINIA; WHICH DECISION HELD THAT A VOTE TO TABLE A MOTION TO PRINT THE RESOLUTION CONTAINED IN THE MEMORIAL WAS IN ORDER.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION TO APPOINT ADDITIONAL CLERKS IN THE LAND OFFICE.

TO AMEND THE BILL H. R. 4 (5 STAT. 453, APP. 9/4/1841), TO APPROPRIATE, FOR A LIMITED TIME, THE PROCEEDS OF THE SALES OF THE PUBLIC LANDS, TO PROVIDE THAT THE PROCEEDS OF LAND SOLD BY THE UNITED STATES WHICH WAS ORIGINALLY INTENDED TO BE USED FOR ROADS IN MISSISSIPPI SHALL BE APPLIED, INSTEAD TO THE CONSTRUCTION OF A RAILROAD FROM BRANDON, MISSISSIPPI TO MONTGOMERY, ALABAMA.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO PROVIDE THAT THE PROCEEDS OF LANDS SOLD ORIGINALLY INTENDED TO BE USED FOR ROADS IN ALABAMA, BE APPLIED TO THE CONSTRUCTION OF A RAILROAD FROM ALABAMA TO MISSISSIPPI.

TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO PROVIDE THAT THIS ACT SHALL NOT BE CON- STRUED TO MEAN THAT THE UNITED STATES SHALL BE INDEBTED TO ANY STATE FOR ITS SHARE OF THE PROCEEDS, NOR IS THERE ANY- THING TO PREVENT CONGRESS FROM REPEALING THIS ACT, WHEN PUB- LIC INTEREST REQUIRES IT TO BE DONE, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF LAND GRANTS.

TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO PROVIDE THAT THE TERRITORIES OF WISCONSIN, IOWA, AND FLORIDA BE INCLUDED WITH THE STATES ENTITLED TO RECEIVE A DIVISION OF THE MONIES RECEIVED FROM THE SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS BY THE UNITED STATES, WHEREEVER SITUATED, TO BE SOLD BEFORE DECEMBER 31.
TO PROVIDE FOR THE PRINTING OF THE MEMORIAL REGARDING THE PROCEEDINGS AND RESOLUTIONS OF A PUBLIC MEETING OF THE CITI- ZENS OF FAUQUIER COUNTY, VIRGINIA.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO PROVIDE THAT THE PUBLIC DEBT MUST BE ENTIRELY CLEARED BEFORE DISTRIBUTION OF MONIES TO THE SEVERAL STATES UNDER THIS ACT.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO PROVIDE THAT PROCEEDS OF SALES OF LANDS MAY BE PAID AT VARIOUS TIMES TO INDIAN TRIBES FOR THE PUR- CHASE OF ANY PORTION OF THE PUBLIC LANDS.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO PREVENT THE EXCLUSION OF PERSONS FROM THE RIGHT OF PREEMPTION IF THEY SETTLE UPON THE LANDS BEFORE SURVEYS ARE MADE.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO ELIMINATE THE CLAUSE RELATING TO THE EXCLUSION OF ALIENS FROM THE BENEFITS OF THIS ACT.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO EXCLUDE THE PROCEEDS OF SALE OF VACANT AND UNAPPROPRIATED LANDS IN TENNESSEE, TO THAT STATE, WHICH WERE RELINQUISHED UNDER CERTAIN CONDITIONS.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO PROVIDE THAT THERE SHALL BE DEDUCTED FROM THE NET PROCEEDS TO BE DISTRIBUTED, ANY SUMS DUE THE UNITED STATES OUT OF TRANSACTIONS OF THE REVOLUTIONARY WAR.
TO PRINT THE MEMORIAL REGARDING PROCEEDINGS OF A MEETING OF CITIZENS OF THE ISLE OF WIGHT COUNTY, VIRGINIA, CONDEMNING THE EXTRA SESSION AND ITS MEASURES.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION REGARDING THE PROCEEDINGS OF A MEET- ING OF CITIZENS OF THE ISLE OF WIGHT COUNTY, VIRGINIA, CON- DEMNING THE EXTRA SESSION AND ITS MEASURES.
TO TABLE H. R. 4.

TO CONSIDER S. 1 (8/13/1841), A BILL TO REPEAL AN ACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE COLLECTION, SAFE-KEEPING, TRANSFER AND DIS- BURSEMENTS OF THE PUBLIC REVENUE, AND TO PROVIDE FOR THE PUNISHMENT OF EMBEZZLERS OF PUBLIC MONEY.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL SATURDAY, CONSIDERATION OF S. 1.
TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO S. 1, WHICH PROVIDES TO REPEAL, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SECTIONS 13 AND 14, THE ACT OF 1836, WHICH REGULATES THE DEPOSITS OF PUBLIC MONEY.

TO CONCUR IN THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO S. 1, TO REPEAL SO MUCH OF THE ACT OF APRIL 14, 1836, (WHICH PROVIDES APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE PAYMENT OF REVOLUTIONARY AND OTHER PENSIONS) AS PRO- VIDES THAT, AFTER MARCH 3, 1837, NO NOTE OF A DENOMINATION UNDER TEN DOLLARS SHALL BE OFFERED IN PAYMENT BY THE UNITED STATES OR THE POST OFFICE DEPARTMENT.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO PROVIDE A GRADUATING SCALE OF PRICES FOR THE PURCHASE OF PUBLIC LANDS THAT HAVE BEEN FOR SALE FOR FIFTEEN YEARS.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO AUTHORIZE THE STATE TO TAX LAND FROM THE TIME OF PURCHASE FROM THE UNITED STATES.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO APPROPRIATE THE PROCEEDS OF THE LANDS TO THE PUBLIC DEFENSE, INSTEAD OF AMONG THE STATES.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO ELIMINATE THE TEN PER CENT GIVEN TO THE NEW STATES.

TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO ELIMINATE THE PROVISION TO GRANT TO CERTAIN STATES 500,000 ACRES OF LAND FOR INTERNAL IMPROVE- MENTS; TO PROVIDE, INSTEAD, A PROVISION TO GRANT THE STATES QUANTITIES OF LAND EQUAL WITH THAT AMOUNT GRANTED TO OHIO.

TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO CEDE TO TENNESSE THE PUBLIC LANDS NOW REMAINING UNSOLD WITHIN ITS BORDERS, TO CEDE SUCH LAND TO OTHER STATES WHEN THEY ARE IN THE UNION AS LONG AS TENNESSEE, AND TO PROVIDE THAT THIS SHALL ONLY OPERATE AS A RELINQUISHMENT OF SUCH PROPERTY ON THE PART OF THE UNITED STATES, RESERVING ALL SITES OF FORTS AND ARMAMENTS THAT HAVE BEEN SELECTED BY CONGRESS.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO ELIMINATE THE PROVISION TO EX- CLUDE FROM PREEMPTION RIGHTS ALL WHO MAY HAVE PREVIOUSLY HAD BENEFIT OF PREEMPTION UNDER ANY OTHER ACT.

TO POSTPONE THE ORDERS OF THE DAY, FOR THE PURPOSE OF CON- SIDERING THE RESOLUTION TO AUTHORIZE THE POSTMASTER GENERAL TO WITHDRAW CERTAIN PAPERS FROM THE FILES OF THE SENATE. MOTION WAS MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF H. R. 4.
TO CONSIDER THE NOMINATIONS OF CHARGE D'AFFAIRES, CONTAINED IN THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE OF JULY 16, 1841.
TO TERMINATE ACTION, FOR THE TIME BEING, ON H. R. 4, IN ORDER TO PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION OF THE PRESIDENT'S VETO MESSAGE ON THE BANK BILL.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO PROVIDE THAT THERE SHOULD BE, IN THE TREASURY  AT THE TIME OF SUCH DISTRIBUTION, A SURPLUS EQUAL TO THE AMOUNT OF SAID NET PROFITS.
TO POSTPONE  UNTIL TOMORROW, RECONSIDERATION OF S. 5, INCOR- PORATING THE SUBSCRIBERS TO THE FISCAL BANK OF THE U. S.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO INCLUDE THE TERRITORIES OF FLORIDA, IOWA, AND WISCONSIN AS ELIGIBLE, AS ARE THE OTHER STATES, TO RECEIVE TEN PER CENT OF THE NET PROCEEDS.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO ELIMINATE THE PROVISION TO RESTRICT THE STATES FROM DISPOSING OF ANY LANDS SO GRANTED AT A PRICE LESS THAN $1.25 PER ACRE.

TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO PROPOSE THAT THE LANDS SHALL BE LOCATED IN PARCELS OF NOT LESS THAN 320 ACRES IN ANY ONE LOCATION ON ANY PUBLIC LAND, INSTEAD OF ON ANY PUBLIC LAND SUBJECT TO ENTRY AT PRIVATE SALE.
TO POSTPONE  UNTIL TOMORROW, FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF S. 5, INCORPORATING THE SUBSCRIBERS TO THE FISCAL BANK.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO PROPOSE TEWLVE AND A HALF PERCENT, IN- STEAD OF TEN PERCENT, OF THE NET PROCEEDS TO THE NEW STATES, FROM THE SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS.
TO TABLE, FOR THE TIME BEING, H. R. 4.
TO POSTPONE  UNTIL FEBRUARY 1, FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF S. 3 (5 STAT. 440, 8/19/1841), A BILL TO ESTABLISH A UNIFORM SYSTEM OF BANKRUPTCY THROUGHOUT THE U. S.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO DISTRIBUTE THE NET PROCEEDS FROM SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE REPRESENTATION OF THE SEVERAL STATES IN CONGRESS.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO GRANT TO THE SEVERAL STATES ANY LAND NOT SOLD OR OTHERWISE DISPOSED OF BY THE UNITED STATES AFTER HAVING BEEN ON THE MARKET FOR TWENTY YEARS.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO REDUCE THE PRICE OF PUBLIC LANDS RE- MAINING UNSOLD FOR CERTAIN LENGTHS OF TIME, AND LIMITING THOSE PERSONS TO WHOM THE LANDS MAY BE SOLD, WITH PROVISIONS FOR CASES OF FRAUD.
TO OVERRIDE THE VETO OF S. 5, A BILL INCORPORATING THE SUB- SCRIBERS TO THE FISCAL BANK OF THE U. S.
TO CONCUR IN THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO S. 4, WHICH ALLOWS THE BANKS TO ISSUE NOTES OF INTERMEDIATE DENOMINATIONS BETWEEN $5.00 AND $10.00 TO COUNTER-ACT THE ISSUE OF OTHER BANKS IN THE DISTRICT.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO DEDUCT FROM THE PROCEEDS OF THE SALE OF LANDS ANY EXPENSES OF INDIAN TREATIES, ANNUITIES AND COSTS OF EXTINGUISHING INDIAN CLAIMS.

TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO PREVENT THE DISTRIBUTION OF ANY MONEY WHATEVER, UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THIS ACT, UNTIL THE WHOLE OF ANY DEBT, CREATED UNDER THE LAWS PASSED AT THE PRESENT SESSION OF CONGRESS, SHALL HAVE BEEN PAID.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO LIMIT THE DURATION OF THIS ACT TO FIVE YEARS.

TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO ELIMINATE FROM THE SECTION, WHICH PRO- VIDED FOR PRE-EMPTION, THAT NO PERSON WHO OWNS THREE HUNDRED AND TWENTY ACRES OF LAND, OR WHO SHALL ABANDON HIS RESIDENCE TO RESIDE ON THE PUBLIC LAND IN THE SAME STATE OR TERRITORY, SHALL ACQUIRE ANY RIGHT OF PRE-EMPTION UNDER THIS ACT.

TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO PREVENT MONEY FROM BEING DISTRI- BUTED UNDER THIS ACT, UNTIL THERE IS A SURPLUS IN THE TREA- SURY WITHOUT MAINTAINING THE TAXES LEVIED UPON THE PEOPLE IN THE OFRM OF DUTIES ON THE NECESSITIES OF LIFE, USED BY THE GENERAL PUBLIC.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT ANY DEBTS A STATE OR TERRITORY MAY HAVE WITH THE GENERAL GOVERNMENT SHALL BE DE- DUCTED FROM ANY MONEY TO BE DISTRIBUTED TO THAT STATE UNDER THIS ACT.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO PREVENT THIS ACT FROM BECOMING EFFECTIVE UNTIL SUCH OF THE PUBLIC DEFENSES AS ARE NOW IN PROGESS SHALL BE COMPLETELY FINISHED.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO PREVENT THE DISTRIBUTION PROPOSED IN THIS ACT WHEN IT MAKES IT NECESSARY TO IMPOSE DUTIES ON IMPORTS IN ORDER TO DEFRAY PROMPTLY ALL THE PUBLIC EXPENDI- TURES.

TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO PREVENT THE DISTRIBUTION PROPOSED IN THIS ACT WHEN IT MAKES IT NECESSARY TO BORROW MONEY OR TO IMPOSE DUTIES ON IMPORTS HIGHER THAN 20%, IN ORDER TO DEFRAY PROMPTLY ALL THE PUBLIC EXPENDITURES.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT THIS ACT SHALL BECOME VOID WHENEVER THE DUTIES ON ANY ARTICLE UNDER THE TARIFF LAW SHALL EXCEED 20%.
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON H. R. 4.

TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO GRANT TO CERTAIN SPECIFIED STATES A QUANTITY OF THE PUBLIC LANDS WITHIN THE LIMITS OF THESE STATES, EQUAL TO THAT GRANTED TO OHIO.  THIS LAND IS FOR INTERNAL IMPROVEMENTS AND SHALL BE SELECTED BY EACH STATE LEGISLATURE.  SIMILAR GRANTS WILL BE MADE TO EACH TERRITORY AS IT BECOMES A STATE.

TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO PREVENT THE DISTRIBUTION PROVIDED FOR UNTIL THERE SHALL BE REFUNDED TO THE PUBLIC TREASURY THE WHOLE AMOUNT OF MONIES PAID FROM THE TREASURY FOR THE PUR- CHASE OF PUBLIC LANDS, EITHER FROM FOREIGN NATIONS, OR FROM THE EXTINCTION OF INDIAN TITLES.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT NO DISTRIBUTION OF MONEY SHALL BE MADE UNDER THIS ACT WHILE ANYTHING IS DUE TO THE INDIAN TRIBES FOR LANDS PURCHASE FROM THEM.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO GRANT PRE-EMPTION RIGHTS TO THOSE SETTLING, IN ADVANCE OF THEIR SURVEYING, ON PUBLIC LANDS.

TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO PERMIT THE HEAD OF EVERY FAMILY THAT SETTLES ON PUBLIC LANDS TO WHICH INDIAN TITLE IS EXTIN- GUISHED, TO BE ENTITLED TO PRE-EMPTION UNDER CERTAIN CIRCUM- STANCES; TO EXEMPT ALL LEGAL RESERVATIONS FROM THIS ACT, AND TO PROVIDE THAT ALL QUESTIONS RELATIVE TO PRE-EMPTION CLAIMS ARE TO BE SETTLED BY REGISTER AND RECEIVER OF THE DISTRICT UNDER INSTRUCTION OF THE GENERAL LAND OFFICE.
TO ADJOURN DUE TO THE LATENESS OF THE HOUR; MOTION MADE DUR- ING DEBATE ON H. R. 4.
TO ADJOURN, DUE TO THE LATENESS OF THE HOUR; MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON H. R. 4.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO DISTRIBUTE EACH SHARE OF THE SALES OF THE PUBLIC LANDS ACCORDING TO THE EXISTING CENSUS EACH STATE.

TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO DISTRIBUTE THE PROCEEDS FROM THE SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH REPRESENTATION IN THE HOUSES, TO BE FIXED BY THE NEW APPORTIONMENT TO BE MADE UNDER THE 1840 CENCUS.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, TO DISTRIBUTE TO THE TERRITORIES OF FLORIDA, WISCONSIN AND IOWA, 10% ON THE AMOUNT OF SALES OF LAND SOLD WITHIN THEIR RESPECTIVE LIMITS.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO INCLUDE THE TERRITORIES OF FLORIDA, IOWA AND WISCONSIN, AS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE 10% OF SALES IN THEIR RESPECTIVE LIMITS.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO PREVENT THE DISTRIBUTION OF REVENUE FROM THE SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS WHENEVER THE DUTIES ON IMPORTS BECOMES MORE THAN 20%.
TO ADJOURN; MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON H. R. 4.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION FIXING A DAY FOR THE ADJOURNMENT OF THE PRESENT SESSION OF CONGRESS.
TO GO INTO EXECUTIVE SESSION.

TO AMEN H. R. 4, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT IF THERE SHOULD BE INCONSISTENCY IN THE IMPOSITION OF DUTIES ON IMPORTS DURING THE EXISTENCE OF THIS ACT, THEN THE DISTRIBUTION PROVIDED IN THIS ACT SHALL BE SUSPENDED.
TO AMEND, IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE, H. R. 4, WHICH SUB- STITUTE PROVIDES TO APPROPRIATE THE PROCEEDS FROM THE SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS TO THE COMMON DEFENSE OF THE UNION.

TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT IF, DURING THE EXISTENCE OF THIS ACT, ANY NECESSITY SHALL ARISE TO BORROW MONEY TO MEET GOVERNMENT EXPENDITURES, THEN THE DISTRIBU- TIONS SHALL CEASE UNTIL ALL DEBT THUS INCURRED SHALL BE ELIMINATED.
TO POSTPONE, UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY IN DECEMBER NEXT, FUR- THER CONSIDERATION OF H. R. 4.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO ELIMINATE THE PROVISION THAT PRE- EMPTION SHOULD NOT APPLY TO ANY PORTION OF THE PUBLIC LANDS THAT HAVE BEEN SELECTED AS A SITE FOR A CITY OR TOWN.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO ELIMINATE THE PROVISION THAT NO LANDS SHALL BE SUBJECT TO PRE-EMPTION ON WHICH ARE KNOWN SALINES OR MINES.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO ELIMINATE PRE-EMPTION RIGHTS OF LANDS WHICH HAVE BEEN SURVEYED PRIOR TO THE ACT.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO ELIMINATE THE PROVISION THAT, NO PARCEL OF LAND SETTLED FOR THE PURPOSE OF TRADE (RATHER THAN AGRICULTURE) SHALL BE LIABLE TO ENTRY UNDER THE PRE-EMPTION CLAUSE.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO EQUALIZE GRANTS OF LAND TO THE NEW STATES WITH THAT ALREADY GRANTED TO OHIO, FOR THE PUR- POSE OF INTERNAL IMPROVEMENTS.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO END THE DISTRIBUTION OF PUBLIC LANDS WHEN THE UNITED STATES HAS "A JUST CAUSE OF WAR", IN- STEAD OF WHEN BECOMING INVOLVED IN SUCH.
TO AMEND H. R. 4, SO AS TO EXEMPT FROM DISTRIBUTION, THE LANDS NOW PREPARED FOR SALE, AND NOT YET OFFERED FOR SALE.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H. R. 4.

TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL H.R. 14, TO PROVIDE FOR THE BETTER COLLECTION, SAFE-KEEPING, AND DISBURSEMENT OF THE PUBLIC REVENUE BY MEANS OF A CORPORATION TO BE STYLED, "THE FISCAL CORPORATION OF THE UNITED STATES".
TO CONSIDER THE RESOLUTION TO FIX A DAY FOR THE ADJOURNMENT OF THE PRESENT SESSION OF CONGRESS.
TO ADJOURN; MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF H. R. 4.

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 4 TO COMMITTEE WITH THE FOLLOWING IN- STRUCTIONS - TO ELIMINATE THAT PART OF THE BILL RELATING TO PRE-EMPTION RIGHTS AND TO PROVIDE, INSTEAD, FOR THE SALE OF LAND UNSOLD AFTER 15 YEARS - WITH SPECIFIC PROVISIONS AND REQUIREMENTS, TO BE CONTAINED IN THE AMENDMENT, REGARDING PRICE, SIZE OF THE PARCEL OF LAND AND ELIGIBILITY.
TO PASS H. R. 4.
TO TABLE THE NOMINATION OF JOHN E. WOOL TO BE BREVET BRIGADIER GENERAL.
TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 12 (5 STAT. L 463, APP. 9/11/1841), RELATING TO DUTIES AND DRAWBACKS, WHICH AMEND- MENT WOULD SUBJECT SPECIFIED PRECIOUS MATERIALS TO A DUTY OF 20%.
TO AGREE TO THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 8, WHICH PROPOSES AN APPROPRIATION FOR THE PURCHASE OF A SITE, FOR BARRACKS AND DEFENSIVE WORKS, AT , OR NEAR, BUFFALO, NEW YORK.
TO INSIST ON THE SENATE AMENDMENT, DISAGREED TO BY THE HOUSE TO H. R. 8, WHICH APPROPRIATES A SUM FOR THE EXPENSES OF SELECTING AND PURCHASING A SITE FOR AN ARMORY.
TO CONSIDER THE RESOLUTION FIXING A DAY FOR THE ADJOURNMENT OF THE PRESENT SESSION OF CONGRESS.

TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE ON THE AMENDMENT TO AN AMENDMENT TO H. R. 12 (5 STAT. L 463, APP. 9/11/1841), RELATING TO DUTIES AND DRAWBACKS; SAID AMENDED AMENDMENT TO REPEAL THE ACT WHICH EXEMPTED RAILROAD IRON FROM DUTY.  THE AMENDMENT ALSO PROVIDES A DEFINITION OF SAID IRON, THE PERCENTAGE OF DUTY TO BE CHARGED, AND PROVISIONS FOR DUTY ON SUCH IRON IMPORTED PRIOR TO DECEMBER 1, 1841.

TO RECEDE FROM THE AMENDMENTS TO H. R. 4, WHICH WERE DISA- GREED TO BY THE HOUSE.  THESE AMENDMENTS PROVIDED THAT THE DISTRIBUTION SHALL BE MADE TO THE STATES ACCORDING TO THEIR RESPECTIVE FEDERAL REPRESENTATION IN CONGRESS.

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDED AMENDMENT TO THE BILL H. R. 30 (APP. 9/9/1841), TO MAKE APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE POST OFFICE DE- PARTMENT.  SAID AMENDMENT PROVIDES $15,000 TO ENABLE THE AUDITOR TO PURCHASE ACCOUNT BOOKS AND TO HIRE TEMPORARY, ADDITIONAL CLERKS.
TO AMEND H. R. 30, TO INCREASE THE SUM TO BE APPROPRIATED IN ORDER TO ELIMINATE THE DEBTS OF THE POST OFFICE.
TO AMEND H. R. 30, BY PROPOSING THAT THE SUM APPROPRIATED BY THIS BILL BE REFUNDED TO THE TREASURY FROM THE FUTURE EARNINGS OF THE POST OFFICE DEPARTMENT.
TO AMEND H. R. 30, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT THE MONEY ADVANCED TO THE TREASURY SHOULD NOT BE DEDUCTED FROM ANY SUMS WHICH THE POST OFFICE DEPARTMENT MAY PAY INTO SAME.

TO AMEND H. R. 30, BY PROPOSING THAT THE FRANKING PRIVILEGE OF EVERY MEMBER OF CONGRESS SHALL CEASE WITHIN THIRTY DAYS AFTER THE EXPIRATION OF THE CONGRESS TO WHICH ELECTED, OR WITHIN THIRTY DAYS AFTER CEASING TO BE A MEMBER.
TO PASS H. R. 30.
TO ADJOURN; MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL H. R. 22 (APP. 9/13/1841), TO PROVIDE FOR THE REPAIRING OF THE POTOMAC BRIDGE.
TO PASS THE BILL S. 8, TO PROVIDE FOR THE SATISFACTION OF THE OUTSTANDING CHOCTAW RESERVATIONS UNDER THE TREATY OF DANCING-RABBIT CREEK OF 1830.
TO TABLE, FOR THE TIME BEING H. R. 12 (5 STAT. 463, APP. 9/11/1841), AN ACT RELATING TO DUTIES AND DRAWBACKS.

TO AMEND H. R. 14, AN ACT PROVIDING FOR THE BETTER COLLEC- TION, SAFEKEEPING AND DISBURSEMENT OF THE PUBLIC MONEY, BY ELIMINATING THE WORD "STATES" FROM THAT PROVISION IN THE BILL ASSIGNING 70,000 SHARES TO INDIVIDUAL COMPANIES, COR- PORATIONS OR STATES.
TO AMEND H. R. 14, SO AS TO PREVENT CORPORATIONS FROM PARTI- CIPATING IN THE PROVISION ASSIGNING 70,000 SHARES, IN ORDER TO LEAVE SUCH TO INDIVIDUAL COMPANIES ONLY.
TO AMEND H. R. 14, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT CORPORATORS IN SAID COROPRATIONS BE CITIZENS OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO AMEND H. R. 14, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT THE STOCK OF THE SAID CORPORATION SHALL BE ASSIGNABLE AND TRANSFERRABLE ONLY TO CITIZENS OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO AMEND H. R. 14, SO AS TO REQUIRE THAT BILLS IN WHICH THE BANK DEALS SHOULD BE DRAWN AT SHORT NOTICE AND ONLY ON GOODS ACTUALLY SHIPPED.
TO AMEND H. R. 14, SO AS TO MAKE THE DIRECTORS, IN CASE OF SUSPENSION, PERSONALLY LIABLE FOR THE DEBTS OF THE BANK.
TO ADJOURN, BECAUSE OF THE LATE HOUR; MOITON MADE DURING DE- BATE ON H. R. 14.
TO AMEND H. R. 14, SO AS TO CHANGE THE PROPORTION OF STOCK TO BE PAID DOWN BY SUBSCRIBERS OTHER THAN THE GOVERNMENT, FROM 10% TO 50%.
TO ADJOURN; MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF H. R. 14.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL H.R. 22 (APP. 9/11/1841) (0), TO PROVIDE FOR THE REPAIR OF THE POTOMAC BRIDGE.
TO ADJOURN; MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON BILL H. R. 14.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF EDWARD BROOKS TO BE COLLEC- TOR OF CUSTOMS FOR THE DISTRICT AND INSPECTOR OF REVENUE FOR PORT OF DETROIT, MICHIGAN.

TO AMEND H. R. 14, SO AS TO GIVE CONGRESS THE RIGHT TO MOD- IFY OR REPEAL THE ACT PURPORTING TO CREATE A PUBLIC CORPOR- ATION AS A FISCAL AGENCY FOR THE GOVERNMENT OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO AMEND H. R. 73, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT EACH DISTRICT SHALL CONTAIN, AS NEARLY AS MAY BE, AN EQUAL NUMBER OF INHABITANTS TO BE REPRESENTED.

TO AMEND H. R. 73, TO DECLARE THAT THE SECOND SECTION SHALL NOT TAKE EFFECT AS TO THE ELECTION OF REPRESENTATIVES FROM CERTAIN STATES UNTIL AFTER THE ELECTION OF REPRESENTATIVES FROM SAID STATES FOR THE 28TH CONGRESS.

TO AMEND H. R. 73, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT IN ANY STATE WHERE IT SHALL BE IMPOSSIBLE TO DISTRICT THE STATE BEFORE THE FIRST ELECTION FOR REPRESENTATIVES, THEN THIS SECTION SHALL NOT APPLY TO SUCH STATE UNTIL THE SECOND ELECTION OF REPRE- SENTATIVES UNDER THIS ACT.

TO AMEND H.R. 73, SO AS TO PROTECT THE PEOPLE OF ANY STATE OR DISTRICT IN THE RIGHT TO BE REPRESENTED AND TO CHOOSE REPRESENTATIVES ACCORDING TO EXISTING STATE LAWS, UNTIL REGULATIONS ARE MADE FOR DISTRICTING.

TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE SENATE CONCURRED IN THE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 73, WHICH PROVIDES THAT THE DISTRICTS SHALL BE EQUAL IN NUMBER OF THEIR INHABITANTS.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H. R. 73, SAID ORIGINAL AMENDMENT PROVIDING THAT EACH DISTRICT SHALL CONTAIN AN EQUAL NUMBER OF INHABITANTS TO BE REPRESENTE:, SO THAT IT PROVIDE THAT NO DISTRICT SHOULD BE SO FAR UNEQUAL TO ANOTHER IN THE NUMBER OF INHABITANTS AS TO EXCEED OR FALL SHORT OF 5,000 OF THE RATIO OF POPULATION.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H. R. 73, WHICH PROVIDES THAT EACH DISTRICT SHALL CONTAIN  AN EQUAL NUMBER OF INHABITANTS TO BE REPRESENTED, SO THAT IT PROVIDE THAT NO DISTRICT SHOULD BE SO FAR UNEQUAL TO ANOTHER IN THE NUMBER OF INHABITANTS, AS TO EXCEED 10,000 OF THE RATIO OF POPULATION.

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 73, WHICH PROVIDES THAT EACH DISTRICT SHALL CONTAIN AN EQUAL NUMBER OF INHABITANTS TO BE REPRESENTED, SO THAT IT PROVIDE THAT NO DISTRICT SHOULD BE SO FAR UNEQUAL TO ANOTHER IN NUMBER OF THE INHABITANTS AS TO EXCEED 20,000 OF THE RATIO OF POPULATION.

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDED AMENDMENT TO H. R. 73, WHICH PRO- VIDES THAT, IN FORMING THE CONGRESSIONAL DISTRICTS OF CONTI- GUOUS TERRITORY, THEY SHALL BE AS NEARLY AS POSSIBLE, EQUAL IN NUMBER OF THEIR INHABITANTS, AND THAT NO ONE DISTRICT SHALL EXCEED ANOTHER IN REPRESENTATIVE POPULATIONS MORE THAN 20,000.

TO AMEND H. R. 73, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT SO MUCH OF THIS ACT AS DIRECTS THE STATE LEGISLATURES TO DIVIDE THE RESPECTIVE STATES INTO DISTRICTS  SHALL BE REGARDED AS DIRECTORY ONLY; CONGRESS NOT ASSUMING THE POWER TO INSTRUCT THE STATE LEGIS- LATURES.

TO AMEND H. R. 73, BY ELIMINATING SECTION TWO, WHICH DIRECTS THE STATE LEGISLATURES TO DIVIDE THE RESPECTIVE STATES INTO DISTRICTS, SO AS TO LEAVE THE STATES FREE TO EXERCISE THEIR OWN DISCRETION AS TO THE MANNER OF ELECTIONS, NO ONE DIS- TRICT ELECTING MORE THAN ONE REPRESENTATIVE.
TO PASS H. R. 73.

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT TO THE BILL S. 257 (5 STAT. L. 502, APP. 8/4/1842), PROVIDING FOR THE ARMED OCCUPATION AND SET- TLEMENT OF THE UNSETTLED PART OF THE EAST FLORIDA PENINSULA, BY ADDING A PROVISION THAT IF SETTLEMENT HAS BEEN MADE ON THE 16TH SECTION BEFORE IT IS SURVEYED, THE UNITED STATES SHALL SELECT WHAT OTHER LANDS CAN BE CLAIMED INSTEAD BY SAID SETTLERS.  THE ORIGINAL AMENDMENT PROVIDED THAT WHEN TWO PERSONS HAVE SETTLED THE SAME QUARTER SECTION OF LAND BEFORE IT IS SURVEYED, IT SHALL BE DIVIDED BETWEEN THEM AND THE DEFICIENCY MADE UP FROM CONTIGUOUS LAND, AND IF ANY PORTION OF SECTION 16 IS SELECTED BY ANY SETTLER, HE IS ENTITLED TO A LIKE QUANTITY OF ANY OTHER LAND IN LIEU THEREOF.

TO INSIST ON THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 73, DISAGREED TO BY THE HOUSE.  SAID AMENDMENT IS THAT STATES HAVING A FRAC- TION MORE THAN A MOIETY OF THE RATIO SHALL BE ENTITLED TO AN ADDITIONAL REPRESENTATIVE.

TO RETAIN THE EIGHTH ARTICLE OF THE TREATY WITH GREAT BRITIAN.  SAID TREATY PROVIDES FOR THE SETTLEMENT AND DEFIN- ITION OF BOUNDARIES BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE POS- SESSIONS OF GREAT BRITIAN IN NORTH AMERICAN, FOR THE FINAL SUPPRESSION OF THE AFRICAN SLAVE TRADE AND FOR THE GIVING UP OF CRIMINALS, FUGITIVES FROM JUSTICE IN CERTAIN CASES.
TO RETAIN THAT PART OF THE FIRST ARTICLE OF THE TREATY WITH GREAT BRITIAN WHICH DESCRIBES IN DETAIL THE BOUNDARIES, NEAR THE ST. LAWRENCE RIVER, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND GREAT BRITIAN.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO RECOMMIT THE TREATY WITH GREAT BRITIAN AND RELATED DOCUMENTS, TO THE COMMITTEE ON FOREIGN RELATIONS, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT AN AMENDMENT TO THE TREATY.  THE AMENDMENT IS TO STIPULATE THE RIGHTS OF THE VESSELS OF THE UNITED STATES DRIVEN BY TEMPESTS OR CARRIED BY VIOLENCE INTO ANY OF THE BRITISH WEST INDIA ISLANDS, SO THAT THEY MAY DEPART FROM THE SAME WITH ALL PERSONS AND PRO- PERTY, WITH ALL CONVENIENT DISPATCH, AND AFTER RECEIVING THE HOSPITABLE TREATMENT DUE TO MISFORTUNE.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION THAT THE TREATY WITH GREAT BRITIAN AND RELATED DOCUMENTS BE RECOMMITTED TO THE COMMITTEE ON FOREIGN RELATIONS WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT A RESOLUTION DIRECTING THE PRESIDENT TO TAKE IMMEDIATE POSSESSION OF THE DISPUTED TERRITORY UP TO THE LINE DESIGNATED BY THE KING OF NETHERLANDS, AND TO MAINTAIN THE STATE OF MAINE IN POSSES- SION OF THE TERRITORY SOUTH OF THAT LINE.

TO RETAIN IN THE FIFTH ARTICLE OF THE TREATY WITH GREAT BRITIAN THE SECTION THAT PROVIDES COMPENSATION TO THE STATES FOR ANY EXPENSES INCURRED BY THEM IN DEFENDING THE DISPUTED TERRITORY, FOR A SURVEY MADE, AND FOR THEIR ASSENT TO THE BOUNDARIES DESCRIBED IN THIS TREATY.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE RATIFI- CATION OF THE TREATY WITH GREAT BRITIAN.

TO AMEND H. R. 804, TO ELIMINATE $47,000 FOR BOOKS AUTHOR- IZED TO BE PURCHASED BY A SIMPLE RESOLUTION AT THE LAST SESSION.
TO AMEND H. R. 804, TO PROVIDE FOR A FURTHER SUM, NOT EX- CEEDING $24,050, TO BLAIR AND RIVES FOR 10,000 COPIES OF THE COMPEDIUM OF THE SIXTH CENSUS.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF BENJAMIN ANDREWS, TO BE DEPUTY POSTMASTER AT CLEVELAND, OHIO.
TO TABLE THE NOMINATION OF A NUMBER OF OFFICERS FOR BREVET PROMOTIONS IN THE ARMY AND MARINE CORPS, CONTAINED IN PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF A NUMBER OF OFFICERS FOR BREVET PROMOTIONS IN THE ARMY AND MARINE CORPS CONTAINED IN PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF WILLIAM K. LATIMER, TO BE A CAPTAIN IN THE UNITED STATES NAVY.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF HENRY A. WISE TO BE ENVOY EXTRAORDINARY AND MINISTER PLENIPOTENTIARY OF THE UNITED STATES TO THE COURT OF HIS MAJESTY THE KING OF FRANCE.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF CALEB CUSHING TO BE SECRE- TARY OF THE TREASURY OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF HENRY A. WISE TO BE ENVOY EXTRAORDINARY AND MINISTER PLENIPOTENIARY OF THE UNITED STATES, TO THE COURT OF HIS MAJESTY THE KING OF FRANCE.
TO CONSENT TO THE RENOMINATION OF CALEB CUSHING, OF MASS., TO BE SECRETARY OF TREASURY OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO RETAIN THE FOURTH AND FIFTH ARTICLES OF THE TREATY WITH TEXAS, REGARDING AMITY, COMMERCE AND NAVIGATION.  ARTICLE FOUR PROVIDES FOR FREE NAVIGATION FOR BOTH PARTIES ON ALL RIVERS ORIGINATING IN TEXAS AND RUNNING INTO THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER.  ARTICLE FIVE RELATES TO DUTY CHARGED ON ANY GOODS EXPORTED FROM EITHER COUNTRY TO FOREIGN COUNTRIES, WITH EXEMPTION OF DUTY ON COTTON.
TO ADOPT THE AMENDED RESOLUTION TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY OF AMITY, COMERCE AND NAVIGATION WITH THE REPUBLIC OF TEXAS.
TO CONSENT TO THE RENOMINATION OF HENRY A. WISE, OF VIRGINIA TO BE ENVOY EXTRAORDINARY AND MINISTER PLENIPOTENIARY OF THE UNITED STATES TO THE COURT OF HIS MAJESTY, KING OF FRANCE.
TO CONSENT TO THE RENOMINATION OF CALEB CUSHING OF MASS., TO BE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF EDWARD EVERETT, TO BE COM- MISSIONER TO CHINA.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF JOHN C. SPENCER, TO BE SE- CRETARY OF THE UNITED STATES TREASURY.
TO POSTPONE THE PREVIOUS ORDERS FOR THE PURPOSE OF CONSIDER- ING H. R. 655 (5 STATS. L 647, APP. 3/3/1843), A BILL TO GRANT PENSIONS TO CERTAIN WIDOWS OF REVOLUTIONARY SOLDIERS.
TO AMEND H. R. 655, TO DEPRIVE ANY WIDOW OF THE PENSION WHO WAS MARRIED TO A REVOLUTIONARY WAR SOLDIER AFTER THE YEAR 1783.
TO TABLE H. R. 655.
TO AMEND H.R. 655, TO REDUCE THE PERIOD DURING WHICH WIDOWS ARE TO RECEIVE PENSIONS, FROM FIVE YEARS TO ONE YEAR, IN ORDER TO ALLOW THE NEXT CONGRESS TO DECIDE WHETHER TO CON- TINUE SUCH PENSIONS.
TO PASS H. R. 655.
TO INSIST ON THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 804, WHICH PRO- VIDES THAT THE SENATE ALLOW ALLEN, BLAIR, AND RIVES, 20% OVER THE PRICE CONTRACTED FOR THE PRINTING OF THE COMPENDIUM OF THE SIXTH CENSUS.
TO TABLE H. R. 720 (APP. 3/3/1843), A BILL TO PROVIDE MEANS FOR FUTURE INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND CHINA BY APPROPRIATING $40,000 TO ESTABLISH COMMERCIAL RELATIONS.

TO AMEND H. R. 720, TO ELIMINATE THE WORD 'RECIPROCITY' IN ORDER TO LEAVE THE APPROPRIATION WITHOUT ANY RESTRICTION, AND TO ELIMINATE THE CLAUSE REQUESTING AN ACCOUNTING BY THE PRESIDENT FOR THE SUM APPROPRIATED FOR A MISSION TO CHINA.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H. R. 720, BY ADDING A PROVISO TO THE AMENDMENT WHICH LIMITS THE ANNUAL COMPENSATION TO ANY ONE PERSON EMPLOYED UNDER THIS ACT, SAID PROVISO TO REQUIRE THE ADVISE AND CONSENT OF THE SENATE ON ANY AGENT SENT TO CHINA UNDER THIS ACT.
TO CONCUR IN THE REPORT OF THE CONFERENCE COMMITTEE REGARD- ING H. R. 804.
